waffleoRai_Utils

Class StreamBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • waffleoRai_Utils.FileBuffer
      • waffleoRai_Utils.StreamBuffer

  • public class StreamBuffer
extends FileBuffer
    For files larger than should be held in memory.
    Since:
    February 3, 2018
    Version:
    1.7.4
    Author:
    Blythe Hospelhorn

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Clear out all of the buffers, modifications, and cache records.
        WARNING: If this buffer is write-enabled, this will delete any modifications since the last write to disk!

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Clear out all of the buffers, modifications, and cache records, and reload buffers with the first (total buffer size) bytes of the file.
        WARNING: If this buffer is write-enabled, this will delete any modifications since the last write to disk!
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file cannot be re-read.

      • getMemoryBurden

        public long getMemoryBurden(java.util.Collection<FileBuffer> inMem)
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Overload for more accurate calculation. If this FileBuffer references another, it can scan a collection of already counted FileBuffers for its parent. If its parent has already been counted, then it will return 0. If not, it will return the amount of memory it or its parent takes up in data.
        Overrides:
        getMemoryBurden in class FileBuffer
        Parameters:
        inMem - Collection (eg. List) of FileBuffer references already counted
        Returns:
        0 if parent is in list, otherwise allocated size of this or parent it references.

      • getMinimumMemoryUsage

        public long getMinimumMemoryUsage()
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Approximate the memory usage, in bytes, of this buffer. This number is a considered a minimum possible value. It only counts the size of all instance variables and objects supposedly unique to this instance. It does not count the potential size of any methods or method pointers. Note that the FileBuffer class contains a lot of methods, and it is quite possible that this alone may increase memory usage.
        Also note that some estimates for the size of unique internally referenced objects may also come in a bit low. This calculation compounds that underestimation.
        The object may, in reality, take up more memory than this indicates. Obtaining a more accurate value from the JVM is somewhat difficult, and may not be necessary.

        IMPORTANT: This function only returns the memory usage for this instance. If this FileBuffer is a readonly buffer that references points in other buffers, but does not contain a byte array or structure itself, the value will NOT include the backing data; only the approximate size the pointers used to reference the parent might be. If the backing buffer is lost or unknown, it might be more prudent to call the ROSubFileBuffer class's getMemoryBurden method!
        Overrides:
        getMinimumMemoryUsage in class FileBuffer
        Returns:
        A size representing the minimum size, in bytes, that this instance likely uses in memory.

      • setWritable

        public void setWritable()
        Enable writing for this stream.
        WARNING: All edits will be held in memory until written to disk. Use sparingly.

        Add three bytes to the end of the file buffer as designated by three LSBs in provided int. Order is determined by FileBuffer's set Endian-ness.
        Overrides:
        add24ToFile in class FileBuffer
        Parameters:
        i24 - The value to insert at the end of the buffer. MSB is discarded.
        position - The index to insert it at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If buffer is read-only locked.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any offsets given are invalid.

      • addToFile

        public void addToFile(FileBuffer addition,
                      long insertPos,
                      long stPos,
                      long edPos)
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Add a piece of another FileBuffer to this FileBuffer
        Overrides:
        addToFile in class FileBuffer
        Parameters:
        addition - The FileBuffer to add
        insertPos - The index of this at which addition will be inserted.
        stPos - The first byte of addition to add.
        edPos - The final byte (exclusive) of addition to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If buffer is read-only locked, or if there is an IOException.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any offsets given are invalid.

      • addEncoded_string

        public void addEncoded_string(java.lang.String charset,
                              java.lang.String myString)
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Encode a string using a given character set into a string of bytes and add to the end of the file buffer.
        Overrides:
        addEncoded_string in class FileBuffer
        Parameters:
        charset - Canonical String name of character set to encode string as.

        Names for common sets:
        ASCII : "ASCII"
        UTF-8 : "UTF8"
        Shift_JIS : "SJIS"
        Shift_JISX0213 : "x-SJIS_0213"

        myString - String to encode
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If buffer is read-only locked.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If position is invalid.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If charset string or provided string is null.
        IllegalCharsetNameException - If the given charset name is illegal.
        UnsupportedCharsetException - If no support for the named charset is available in this instance of the Java virtual machine.
        See Also:
        Charset

      • addEncoded_string

                              java.lang.String myString,
                              long pos)

        Overrides:

        Shift_JIS : "SJIS"

        public void writeFile(java.lang.String path,
                      long stPos,
                      long edPos)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Write a file to disk using the path string provided. Will fail if path is invalid. Will create any directories specified in path that do not currently exist.
        Overrides:
        writeFile in class FileBuffer

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - If there is a threading error in writing to disk - buffer fill and buffer write threads have difficulty joining.
        java.io.IOException - If path is invalid or file could not be written.

      • appendToFile

        public void appendToFile(java.lang.String path,
                         long stPos,
                         long edPos)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Append the contents of this FileBuffer to an existing file, if possible.
        Overrides:
        appendToFile in class FileBuffer
        Parameters:
        path - Path of existing file to append to
        stPos - Offset of first byte in buffer to write (inclusive)
        edPos - Offset of first byte in buffer to not write at end (exclusive)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - If there is a threading error in writing to disk - buffer fill and buffer write threads have difficulty joining.
        java.io.IOException - If target file could not be opened or written to
        java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException - If target file does not exist

      • createCopy

        public FileBuffer createCopy(int stPos,
                             int edPos)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: FileBuffer
        Create a new copy of the file buffer. This creates a fresh copy - it does not reference the existing file buffer. It should thus be noted that consumption of memory will increase accordingly.
        Overrides:
        createCopy in class FileBuffer
        Parameters:
        stPos - Starting position of copy procedure (inclusive)
        edPos - Ending position of copy procedure (exclusive)
        Returns:
        New FileBuffer whose contents are identical to this one.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If copying requires disk access and disk access failed for any reason.
